intro: Gayophytum humile var. densifolium, commonly known as the dense-leaved gayophytum, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Cactaceae family and is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit. The plant features dense clusters of small, fleshy leaves that help it conserve water in arid environments. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, appearing in clusters and blooming during the warmer months. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and ability to thrive in well-drained soil.
